abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column explores findings of Equilar analysis of executive compensation that found companies with greater gender diversity on boards pay their chief executives roughly 15 percent more; examines why presence of more women on boards has not helped curb pay, as she expected.

headline.print_headline: Boards With More Women Grant Higher Pay
headline.main: Where More Women Are on Boards, Executive Pay Is Higher

snippet: An analysis by Equilar last year found that among 100 large companies, those with greater gender diversity on their boards paid their chief executives about 15 percent more.
lead_paragraph: An analysis by Equilar last year found that among 100 large companies, those with greater gender diversity on their boards paid their chief executives about 15 percent more.
